tool.name: TD MSGF+ MSMS Search
tool.command:
#set $new_output = $input_file.display_name.split(".")[0]+"_target" #set $new_decoy_output = $input_file.display_name.split(".")[0]+"_decoy" #set $input_name = $input_file.display_name.split(".")[0] ln -s '$input_file' '${input_name}'; /galaxy-central/tools/wohl-proteomics/MSGFcrux/msgfplus_search.rb --galaxy -d $database.target_fasta_file
--var-mods=' $variable_mods #for $custom_variable_mod in $custom_variable_mods: ${custom_variable_mod.custom_mod}___ #end for '
--fix-mods=' $fixed_mods #for $custom_fix_mod in $custom_fix_mods: ${custom_fix_mod.custom_mod}___ #end for '
'$input_name' -o '$new_output' -r --enzyme=$enzyme --precursor-ion-tol-units=$precursor_tolu -p $precursor_ion_tol --instrument=$instrument --isotope-error-range=$isotope_error_range --fragment-method=$fragment_method --protocol=$protocol --min-pep-len=$min_pep_len --max-pep-len=$max_pep_len --max-pep-charge=$max_pep_charge --ntt=$cleavage_semi --min-pep-charge=$min_pep_charge --num-reported-matches=$num_reported_matches --java-mem=$java_mem --num-mods=$num_mods --threads $threads &
/galaxy-central/tools/wohl-proteomics/MSGFcrux/msgfplus_search.rb --galaxy -d $database.decoy_fasta_file
--var-mods=' $variable_mods #for $custom_variable_mod in $custom_variable_mods: ${custom_variable_mod.custom_mod}___ #end for '
--fix-mods=' $fixed_mods #for $custom_fix_mod in $custom_fix_mods: ${custom_fix_mod.custom_mod}___ #end for '
'$input_name' -o '$new_decoy_output' -r --enzyme=$enzyme --precursor-ion-tol-units=$precursor_tolu -p $precursor_ion_tol --instrument=$instrument --isotope-error-range=$isotope_error_range --fragment-method=$fragment_method --protocol=$protocol --min-pep-len=$min_pep_len --max-pep-len=$max_pep_len --max-pep-charge=$max_pep_charge --ntt=$cleavage_semi --min-pep-charge=$min_pep_charge --num-reported-matches=$num_reported_matches --java-mem=$java_mem --num-mods=$num_mods --threads $threads &
wait ; mv '$new_output' '$target_output'; mv '$new_decoy_output' '$decoy_output'

param.name: input_file
param.label: MSMS File
param.help: An mzML file with MS/MS data

param.name: num_mods
param.label: Maximum number of modifications per peptide

repeat.name: custom_variable_mods
repeat.title: Custom Variable Modifications
repeat.help: See https://bix-lab.ucsd.edu/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=13533355 for details on how to create these

repeat.name: custom_fix_mods
repeat.title: Custom Fixed Modifications
repeat.help: See https://bix-lab.ucsd.edu/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=13533355 for details on how to create these

param.name: cleavage_semi
param.label: Allow semi-cleaved peptides
param.help: num of required enzymatic termini, this can increase search time dramatically

param.name: isotope_error_range
param.help: Takes into account of the error introduced by chooosing a non-monoisotopic peak for fragmentation.
param.label: Isotope Error Range

param.name: num_reported_matches
param.help: Number of matches per spectrum to be reported
param.label: Num reported matches

param.name: java_mem
param.help: Increase this value if you get out of memory errors
param.label: Java Memory Limit

param.name: threads
param.label: Threads
param.help: Number of threads to use for search.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Runs an MS/MS database search using the MSGFPlus search engine. Output is in the form of a mzid file containing identified peptides along with their raw search scores.
----
**References**
Please see http://proteomics.ucsd.edu/Software/MSGFPlus.html for details of the MSGFPlus search engine and references describing its algorithm
